meanings.definition: Mold (a material) before its final shaping.
meanings.sent1: She carefully premolds the clay before creating her sculpture.
meanings.sent2: The factory premolds the plastic before assembling the toys.
meanings.sent3: The artist accidentally premolded the dough into a funny shape, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: His ideas were premolded by his childhood experiences, shaping his perspective.
meanings.sent5: Premolding the ingredients ensures a perfect result every time.

meanings.definition: The act or process of molding something before its final shaping.
meanings.sent1: The premolding of the metal is a crucial step in the production process.
meanings.sent2: They have a special machine for premolding the plastic parts.
meanings.sent3: The premolding of the cake batter looked like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was like the premolding of a masterpiece waiting to be revealed.
meanings.sent5: The premolding of the clay revealed intricate details in the final sculpture.
